title:
Singularity categories of rational double points in arbitrary
  characteristic
abstract:
We establish a one-to-one correspondence between the singularity categories
of rational double points and the simply-laced Dynkin graphs in arbitrary
characteristic. This correspondence is well-known in characteristic zero since
the rational double points are quotient singularities in characteristic zero
whereas not necessarily in positive characteristic. Considering some rational
double points are not taut in characteristic two, three or five, we can see
there exist two rational double points which are not analytically isomorphic
but whose singularity categories are triangulated equivalent. As an
application, we construct a counter-example in positive characteristic of a
theorem of Hua and Keller: the dg singularity category of a hypersurface
singularity determines its Tyurina algebra.
